result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert P Pirk Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 3 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert P Pirk Jr

records.addlTxt: Per RCSO, DNA collected - 11-17-2015 at 10:15 am

Defendant Robert P Pirk in court with attorney Christopher James Simonds.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Plea - Ct.1 - 15CM2164 - G.
BTC: Ct.1 - 15CM2164 - GUILTY.    Ct.2 - DRI.    15CM2222 - DRI.

$450 inclusive of costs, apply bond from case 15CM2222, pp $50/mo beg 1-1-16, ftp 3 days RCJ for contempt.
from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in compliance with agency requirements.

Defendant Robert P Pirk in court with attorney Christopher James Simonds.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter is scheduled on Def's motion to modify bond.
Def is moving to remove the SCRAM unit on case 15CM2222 for reasons stated on the record.
State does not object.
BTC: Modify bond in case 15CM2222 to remove the SCRAM unit, deft must be tested at least 3 times per week.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible

Pre-trial conference at 10-15-2015 03:15 pm.
Status conference at 11-17-2015 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with any taverns. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Robert P Pirk in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Robert P Pirk in custody.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
